properties.name: simplix.auth.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable SimpliX authentication functionality.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.enable-token-endpoints
properties.description: Whether to enable JWE token endpoints (/api/token/**).

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.enable-web-security
properties.description: Whether to enable web security with form login.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.enable-cors
properties.description: Whether to enable CORS configuration.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.enable-csrf
properties.description: Whether to enable CSRF protection.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.enable-xss-protection
properties.description: Whether to enable XSS protection headers.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.enable-hsts
properties.description: Whether to enable HTTP Strict Transport Security.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.enable-http-basic
properties.description: Whether to enable HTTP Basic authentication.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.require-https
properties.description: Whether to require HTTPS for all requests.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.prefer-token-over-session
properties.description: Whether to prioritize Bearer token authentication over session authentication when both are present. When true, if a request contains both a valid Bearer token and a session cookie (JSESSIONID), the token will be used for authentication and the session will be ignored.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.hsts-max-age-seconds
properties.description: HSTS max age in seconds.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.csrf-ignore-patterns
properties.description: CSRF ignore patterns.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.login-page-template
properties.description: Login page template name.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.login-processing-url
properties.description: Login processing URL.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.logout-url
properties.description: Logout URL.

properties.name: simplix.auth.security.permit-all-patterns
properties.description: URL patterns that are permitted without authentication.

properties.name: simplix.auth.cors.allowed-origins
properties.description: CORS allowed origins.

properties.name: simplix.auth.cors.allowed-methods
properties.description: CORS allowed methods.

properties.name: simplix.auth.cors.allowed-headers
properties.description: CORS allowed headers.

properties.name: simplix.auth.cors.exposed-headers
properties.description: CORS exposed headers.

properties.name: simplix.auth.cors.allow-credentials
properties.description: Whether to allow credentials in CORS.

properties.name: simplix.auth.cors.max-age
properties.description: CORS max age in seconds.

properties.name: simplix.auth.jwe.encryption-key
properties.description: JWE encryption key (RSA private key in PEM format).

properties.name: simplix.auth.jwe.encryption-key-location
properties.description: Location of JWE encryption key file.

properties.name: simplix.auth.jwe.algorithm
properties.description: JWE encryption algorithm.

properties.name: simplix.auth.jwe.encryption-method
properties.description: JWE encryption method.

properties.name: simplix.auth.token.access-token-expiration-minutes
properties.description: Access token expiration time in minutes. The access token is used for API authentication and should have a shorter lifetime for security.

properties.name: simplix.auth.token.refresh-token-expiration-days
properties.description: Refresh token expiration time in days. The refresh token is used to obtain new access tokens without re-authentication.

properties.name: simplix.auth.token.enable-ip-validation
properties.description: Whether to validate client IP address in token. When enabled, tokens can only be used from the same IP address where they were issued. Disable this for mobile apps and environments with changing IP addresses.

properties.name: simplix.auth.token.enable-user-agent-validation
properties.description: Whether to validate User-Agent header in token. When enabled, tokens can only be used from the same browser/client where they were issued. Disable this if User-Agent changes frequently.

properties.name: simplix.auth.token.enable-token-rotation
properties.description: Whether to enable token rotation. When enabled, a new token pair is issued upon each refresh, and the old refresh token is invalidated.

properties.name: simplix.auth.token.enable-blacklist
properties.description: Whether to enable token blacklist for revocation. When enabled, tokens can be explicitly revoked (e.g., on logout). Requires a blacklist implementation (Redis, Caffeine, or In-Memory).

properties.name: simplix.auth.token.blacklist-type
properties.description: Token blacklist implementation type. 'auto' will automatically select Redis if available, otherwise Caffeine, then In-Memory.

properties.name: simplix.auth.token.create-session-on-token-issue
properties.description: Whether to create HTTP session when issuing tokens. When enabled, both token and session authentication are available. When disabled, only token-based authentication is used (stateless).
